page.title: 11Scrap Metals - Tamar Valley
page.content: The Scrap yard at Greenhill is run by a merchant, Mr. Henry Flashman. He has a fairly large range of machines such as car crushers, wheel crushers and cranes including standard and electro-magnetic ones. He also has a grab for ripping out engine blocks. Once the car is crushed into a block, it is sent to Cardiff to be melted down and recycled. Engine blocks are sent to the Midlands,to be re-used. All hard steels are sent to Spain via Millbay Docks at Plymouth. After the wheels are crushed the tyres are sold to local farmers to hold down the polythene sheets covering their silage pits. Mr. Flashman generates his own electricity for his machinery and has two large generators and a smaller one, with which he claims he could supply the whole of Gunnislake and Calstock with electricity if needed.
